detail: Shaping the 17th GeoMundus Conference held on Oct 16 - 18, 2025 (Lisbon, Portugal), including theme, workshops, and program structure.
Learned agile and scrum practices from industry experts in Nepal’s tech ecosystem.
Built Microsoft Tech community in Nepal, organized tech events, workshops, and mentored ambassadors.
Co-led and initiated the Farwest Team (Province 7), building the provincial tech community and managing technical/non-technical events.
Built an online tech community (2,700+ students), organized training/workshops, and mentored students.
Instructed a week-long “Write the Web” workshop, teaching fundamental web technologies to high school students at Anne Frank Gesamtschule, Münster.

organization: School of Engineering, Far Western University
detail: Delivered a keynote “Reflections on College, Tech, and Career” at my alma mater guiding and inspiring computer engineering and computer science students.
Mentored a 48 hour national level hackathon guiding 10 teams to refine their ideas and product.
Mentored 10 participating teams to refine project ideas and assess technical feasibility.

organization: Microsoft Build After Party Nepal Edition
detail: Delivered a talk on “What and Why of the Tech Community?” to inspire student leaders.
Organized the national edition with hundreds of participants, helping students improve project ideas.
Organized Nepal’s largest 48-hour hackathon with participants from all 7 provinces.
Delivered a session on “Software Development 101” guiding young tech students about software development lifecycle and roadmap.

organization: Microsoft Ignite 2022 After Party Nepal Edition
detail: Organized the national edition with keynotes from Microsoft Regional Directors and MVPs.
Competed in a 48-hour hackathon with 150 participants; won Best Business Idea Award.
Organized and hosted Nepal’s Hacktoberfest to promote open-source contributions.

organization: Frontend Bootcamp, Far Western University, Nepal
detail: Designed and taught a month-long bootcamp, training 40 female students in frontend development, free of cost to inspire thier career in tech.
Delivered a keynote on “Challenges & Opportunities for Computer Science Students” to 350 in-person participants in tech seminar; my first-ever public speaking experience!
Awarded the prestigious Erasmus Mundus Scholarship for M.Sc. in Geospatial Technologies at Universitat Jaume I (Spain), University of Münster (Germany), and Universidade Nova de Lisboa (Portugal).
First fellow from Nepal; received a full scholarship to join the Climatebase Fellowship program; built Nepal Climate Hub as fellowship project which now turned into a now profit of 18 team members.
Ranked top of the Computer Science department; five-time semester topper and entrance exam topper.
Selected as one of 20 student partners nationwide (500+ applicants); first from Province 7.
First ambassador from university and Province 7 (2022); awarded the highest milestone in Nepal (2023) for my impact.
Recognized as one of two tech community leaders from my province for contributions to building regional tech communities at GitHub Field Day Nepal 2022.
Awarded for securing first place in the Computer Science entrance examination.
